column2: Trees are prone to die during period of drought and prefer consistent water condition ; more established tree are le prone to drought .
Well-drained soil is essential a they will not survive in soggy waterlogged soil .

Seeds ten to twelve , chestnut brown , one-fourth of an inch long -can be made to germinate by first dipping in boiled ( 99C ) water ( very hot ) for a minute and then sowing in a pot ( do not boil the seed ) ; cotyledon oval , flat .
However , rhizomatous coreopsis ( underground stem ) are well-adapted to withstand the extreme in soil moisture ( both wet and dry ) .

a it is useful a a green screen ( instead of Pampass grass ) , erosion control , water retention and nest material for many specie of birdsThis specie is a perennial grass forming clump of erect stem up to 1.5 meter tall .

The genus name Nerium is the Latinized form of the Ancient Greek name for the plant Nerion ( νήριον ) , which is in turn derived from the Greek for water , 'neros ' ( νηρός ) , because of the natural habitat of the oleander along river and stream .
The plant is tolerant of poor soil , intense heat , salt spray , and sustained drought – although it will flower and grow more vigorously with regular water .
This inhibits the circulation of water in the tissue of the plant , causing individual branch to die until the entire plant is consumed .
They usually tolerate salt-spray , and moderate drought where the water table is permanently high .
